docs.lead_paragraph: Rosie Napravnik was riding with a secret, and she couldn't keep it any longer once Untapable won the $2 million Breeders' Cup Distaff.

byline.original: By ANAHAD O'CONNOR and LINDSAY CROUSE

docs.lead_paragraph: Clara Horowitz Peterson is an elite distance runner who continues to train during her pregnancies. She shows some of her techniques for staying fit.

docs.lead_paragraph: After her training partner died of a heart attack, Buzunesh Deba, who is a favorite in Sunday’s race, had to work through her grief to allow her focus to return to running.

headline.main: New York Marathon 2014: Will to Win Returns After Training Partner’s Death
headline.print_headline: Will to Win Returns After Training Partner’s Death

docs.abstract: Buzunesh Deba and Meskerem Legesse were training partners, roommates and best friends in the international world of elite running; Legesse died of a heart attack at 26 in 2013, and recovering from the grief has proved harder for Deba than winning any marathon; attempting to become first New York resident to win upcoming New York Marathon since 1976, Deba says she is now ready to win the race for her lost partner.
docs.snippet: After her training partner died of a heart attack, Buzunesh Deba, who is a favorite in Sunday’s race, had to work through her grief to allow her focus to return to running.

docs.lead_paragraph: An indictment provides an unusually detailed account of how Ismail Issa, 24, ended up under arrest on suspicion of supporting jihadists.

headline.main: German Shopping Spree Brings Terrorism Charge
headline.print_headline: German Shopping Spree Brings Terrorism Charge

docs.abstract: German authorities allege that immigrant Ismail Issa is supplier to radicals in Syria; charges follow shopping spree by Issa in which he purchased military gear in Germany destined for transport to Syria; indictment against Issa paints clear picture of young man's evolution from alienated immigrant to extremist.
docs.snippet: An indictment provides an unusually detailed account of how Ismail Issa, 24, ended up under arrest on suspicion of supporting jihadists.

docs.lead_paragraph: The North Dakota Supreme Court upheld on Tuesday a state law that restricts medication abortion, the non-surgical interruption of a pregnancy using drugs, saying it was constitutional.

headline.main: North Dakota Supreme Court Upholds Restrictions on Medication Abortion
headline.print_headline: North Dakota Supreme Court Upholds Restrictions on Medication Abortion

docs.snippet: The North Dakota Supreme Court upheld on Tuesday a state law that restricts medication abortion, the non-surgical interruption of a pregnancy using drugs, saying it was constitutional.

docs.lead_paragraph: North Dakota's sole abortion provider stopped providing medication abortions Wednesday in the wake of a state Supreme Court ruling that blocked the use of pregnancy-terminating drugs, though surgical abortions were still being provided, the clinic's director said.

headline.main: Bringing Lessons From a Pool in Pakistan to a Pitch Meeting With Investors

docs.abstract: As a teenager in Pakistan, Shaan Kandawalla was not permitted to compete in the 1996 Olympics because of her gender. That background has prepared her to take on the male-dominated tech world.
